hackathon-description-text: Come embark on a 48 hour journey as we set sail with other innovators, creatives, thinkers and doers for a weekend full of learning and healthy competition. The three themes will navigate your ideas. Maybe it’s a problem that needs to be solved, an idea without the time, a skill that could help someone else, or just silly geekery, we welcome all skill levels and reasons for hanging out. Choose your own adventure for a chance to win some serious treasures.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Social Impact Entrepreneur; founder of the education technology company HUMAN STORM
User Experience Lead at eDaptive Systems; organizer of Ignite Baltimore
CEO and Co-Founder of 410 Labs; founder of the Baltimore Angels; Curator of TedxMidAtlantic
Leader of the advanced innovation team at Stanley Black and Decker
VP of North America E-Commerce at Under Armour

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Using tech to solve a problem, be funny, create a product, or start a business!
Sponsored by Stanley Black and Decker
Judged by Baltimore City's Chief Data Officer Heather Hudson. All projects are eligible to win this prize.
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Mayor's Office of Information Technology Choice

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1045 Light St, Baltimore, MD 21230, USA
